getSqlCreateSpatialTable

public java.lang.String getSqlCreateSpatialTable(com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.drivers.DBLayerDefinition dbLayerDef,
                                                 com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.drivers.FieldDescription[] fieldsDescr,
                                                 boolean bCreateGID)
It builds MySQL "CREATE TABLE" statement. In PostGIS, its usual first create alphanumeric table, and after that add a geometry column for geometries.

Parameters:
dbLayerDef - data of the new table (name, etc)
fieldsDescr - schema of the new table
bCreateGID - @DEPRECATED
Returns:
SQL statement with MySQL sintax

getSqlInsertFeature

public java.lang.String getSqlInsertFeature(com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.drivers.DBLayerDefinition dbLayerDef,
                                            com.iver.cit.gvsig.fmap.core.IFeature feat)
Based in code from JUMP (VividSolutions) and Geotools Things to be aware: We always will use Spatial Tables with Unique ID. IFeature has the same field order than dbLayerDef.getFieldNames()

Parameters:
dbLayerDef -
feat -
Returns:
